To answer your questions, I would suggest Clover as an alternative to
inve=
stigate.  I tend to doubt that it comes with an integration for
NetBeans, b=
ut perhaps you can glue it in there somehow.

Your second question has an e=
asy answer: Ant.  I would VERY surprised if the
coverage tools you've alrea=
dy mentioned didn't have Ant integration.  So,
it's not integrated into you=
r IDE, but at least your tests and the coverage
tools could run together.

=
Good luck...

Subject: [junit] Code Coverage Analysis Tool

I would like to ask are there=
 any code coverage analysis tools can be 
integrated with JUnit and NetBean=
?

I've tried Rational PureCoverage and JCover, but they both requires 
an =
executable test script......so how can I use these tools to 
integrate with=
 the test scripts written for JUnit?

Thanks in advance.
